posts.author: Aart24
posts.post_text: March 10, 2012 at 6:03 PM#6Hi Florian,Correct me if I`m wrong, but I understand that you want a macro that is able to:- set the current selection to color preset 1- store this as cue 1 in the selected executer- repeat this process for all the color presetsTo do this you need some kind of loop with a counter. I created a counter macro for this purpose that is able to increase a number (up to 512) by 1. The main macro needs to know the number of the counter and its own macronumber. Therfore the main macro starts with two variable declarations that you have to edit if you don´t load the macros at position 1 and 2.As far as I know there is no way that a macro can know how many color presets you have unless you enter this date. To make it a little more flexible you also have the option to enter a start preset, so that you can use the macro with any group of succeding presets.I didn´t experiment to much with it, but it seems to workGood luck,AartFilesBuildSeq.xml48.37 kB – 94 Downloads

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: March 10, 2012 at 6:33 PM#7Hi Aart,I am afraid that you count macro may fail with larger numbers (>9), as variables on the grandMA are strings, not numbers, and comparisons [$a>$b] are performed character by charactere.g. "234" is considered to be less than "56" as 2 is less than 5.I believe you may workaround this isssue if your counter-lines are changed toe.g<text>SetUserVar $cnt=002</text>instead of<text>SetUserVar $cnt=2</text>

posts.author: Aart24
posts.post_text: March 11, 2012 at 8:35 AM#8Thanks Glad, you´re so right. I created this in a hurry (still working on my own little project) and the counter wasn´t build initially with the idea to use it´s results in a comparation.To get the comparation right I´ll also need to add leading zeros to $preEnd, so I adapted the count macro to create a prefix macro as well that does just that.Furthermore I forgot to use the $preStart variable as the stating point (the macro started always with preset 4.1). Now it is fixed.Finaly I introduced $loolLine (think I got this from one of your macros) to be able to adapt the macro mor flexible and relyable.Here´s the result,AartFilesBuildSeq2.xml96.23 kB – 86 Downloads
